intro: Didymoplexiella hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan didymoplexiella, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite and have a smooth texture, while its stems are typically woody and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
